1604064808_mirrored_HelloZeroNet_github.body: - How to fix the '1 file upload failed' issue?

1604064889_mirrored_HelloZeroNet_github.body:
+1
These features would be great since the compression for text files can get up to ~70%, which is required when dealing with big DBs.
A better UX on setting and updating a site size limit would be a good companion to these features (ie: what happens when a size surpass the size limit).

1604065488_mirrored_makdisse_github.body:
You're right. I had to install `coffee` to make it work. I probably got it wrong because the windows bundle comes with the compiler but on linux I have just the repo clone.
thanks!

This is what I had to do on Ubuntu 16.04

```
apt-get install nodejs npm
npm install -g coffee-script
ln -fs /usr/bin/nodejs /usr/local/bin/node
```

topic.title: No coffeescript compiler defined, skipping compiling
topic.body:
I keep having this problem: 
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/blob/master/src/Debug/DebugMedia.py#L84

I'm running ZeroNet  0.4.1 rev1529 on ubuntu with the flags --debug and --ui_ip.
Doesn't help to restart zeronet.

What can cause this problem and how to fix it?
